lines.text: Dead man's nothin' but a corpse. No one cares what he is now.
I just don't understand you. You can't eat with them unless there's a war. Even then, it's difficult. Isn't that so?
That's right.
You pay for a ticket, but you even have to sit in the back of a public bus. Isn't that so?

That's right. A hundred years ago, I couldn't even ride a bus. At least now I can sit in the back. Maybe in fifty years, sit in the middle. Someday even up front. There's some things you just can't rush.
When I get out of this, I'm gonna join the Air Force. No more beetle-crushing for me!

Aw, be smart. There's nothing like the infantry. If you're in a plane and get hit, what happens? You still gotta fall. There's two strikes against you. If you're on a ship and get hit, you can drown. In a tank, you can fry like an egg. But in the infantry, you get hit and that's it. One or the other, you're dead or alive. But you're on the ground. Get wise, there's nothing like the infantry.
Is he kidding?

[screaming at critically wounded Korean major as he grabs him from the collar]
If you die, I'll kill yuh!
[while the squad searches Korean civilians]
They all look alike to me.
Don't you know how to tell the difference, Fat Paul?
No.
He's South Korean when he's running with you. He's North Korean when he's running AFTER you.
Well, Sergeant, I told you it was a waste of time.
If I was right all the time I'd be an officer, Lieutenant.
You talk more like a dog face than a gook.
I am no gook. I am Korean!
Where's your people?
With Buddha.
What's that paper on your back for?
Prayer to Buddha asking him to heal me if I am wounded.
Oh, yeah? I thought you forgot to take off the pricetag.
Where's your officer?
Fertilizing a rice paddy with the rest of the patrol.
I found a dead American.
Are you sure he's dead? You gotta be sure, you know.
Half his head is gone.
I better check.
He said his head was gone. Save your strength.
First we'll eat; then we'll bury them.
Look, Lieutenant, you got nuthin' out threre but rice paddies crawlin' with Commies just waitin' to slap you between two big hunks of rye bread and wash you down with fish eggs and vodka.

Baldy, Zack, Buddha-Head, and Thompson]
Say, what kind of outfit is this anyway?
Uh, U. S. Infantry.
Did you hear the Colonel? Hear what he said?
Yeah. Yeah I heard what he said.
Well, what are we waitin' for? Get off the Beach. Get those Krauts. Gotta get off the beach.
